In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for wrapping string:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width=10)
    words = split(s)
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) <= text_width 
            push!(line, " ")
            push!(line, word)
        else 
            println(line)
            line = ""
            push!(line, " ")
            push!(line, word)
        end 
    end 
    return line
end

# Example usage:
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed nulla nunc, varius non eros id, mollis volutpat justo."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

The `wrap_string` function splits the input string into words and checks whether adding a new word would exceed the specified width of text. If it wouldn't, then the word is appended to the current line, otherwise, a new line is started and the word is added there instead. The process continues until all words have been processed. 

The function returns the remaining line after processing all the input words as in case when the last line does not exceed specified width, it will not be printed.
